name: market for green manure, organic, until February | green manure, organic, until February | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15856/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'green manure, organic, until February', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;The product 'green manure, organic, until February'  represents the cultivation of green manure on an area of 1 ha until February. The dry matter yield is 2300 kg/ha. Green manure is not harvested but incorporated into the soil, its reference function is 1 ha cultivated land. Green manure is used as soil cover during winter to reduce soil erosion and nitrate leaching for spring-sown crops. An user employing this module should use 1 ha of green manure corresponding to the area required to produce 1 kg of product of spring-sown crop. The end date for green manure was chosen on the basis of the date of soil cultivation of the spring-sown crop in question. Users should employ the respective model of green manure depending on the date of soil cultivation for their crop. This product is produced through organic agricultural practices which do not include fertiliser and pesticide application.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'green manure, organic, until February',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  green manure, organic, until February', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
